title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 May 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:22 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rcfedf18 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/cfedf183a95a7cfbb838126e3f82f559bda6497c / (7 files in 3 dirs): XRENDERING-206: [[path:]] and [[attach:]] links are incorrectly marked as external links - http://git.io/DqWAjw

01:17 <rrodriguez> has quit  
02:12 <qwebirc6325> has joined #xwiki  
02:14 <qwebirc6325> Hey guys, I updated the location of my attachment to local instead of the DB, and i noticed two things, the xwiki logo and noavatar picture became missing. So I then checked inside the table xwikiattachment, edited one of the fields and committed the change using dbedit. Strange thing occurred yet again, all the rest of the fields in the table disappeared and the field that i edited was the only one remaining... not sure what ha  
02:15 <qwebirc6325> personally, im used to mySQL, but happy to work with HSQL if i can understand it better..  
02:17 <@cjd> do you have a wiki with pages or are you just testing right now?  
02:17 <qwebirc6325> wiki with pages, starting to build it up. why?  
02:17 <@sdumitriu> You should never edit the database directly  
02:18 <@sdumitriu> And after changing attachments from DB to filesystem, you should run the attachment porter (right cjd?)  
02:18 <qwebirc6325> ohhh..  
02:18 <@cjd> correct  
02:18 <qwebirc6325> where abouts can i find the attachment porter?  
02:18 <@cjd> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Filesystem+Attachment+Porter  
02:18 <@sdumitriu> It's normal that the logo went missing, it was stored in the database, and when you change the storage, existing attachments don't transfer themselves automatically  
02:18 <qwebirc6325> I guess i could set up a new xwiki and bring the content over one by one again  
02:19 <qwebirc6325> bugger :/  
02:19 <@cjd> if you were just starting out, I would suggest beginning again with FS attachments turned on from the start rather than using the porter.  
02:19 <@cjd> As it is, you have to use the porter.  
02:22 <qwebirc6325> Okay, im just reading at step 3  
02:22 <qwebirc6325> copy attachments from database  
02:23 <qwebirc6325> im probably going to start again, but just so i know. I would download the porter script and attach or place where?  
02:24 <qwebirc6325> @sdumitriu you said yesterday that its best to place the database files in the data folder not the database folder, why is that?  
02:40 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r70f6bad https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/70f6bad33b1117b6fb78f313e7d13f0662809a6d / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-rendering/xwiki-platform-rendering-wikimacro/xwiki-platform-rendering-wikimacro-api/src/test/java/org/xwiki/rendering/internal/macro/wikibridge/DefaultWikiMacroTest.java : XRENDERING-206: [[path:]] and [[attach:]] links are incorrectly marked as external links - http://git.io/KzHwAQ  
02:56 <qwebirc6325> XWiki is aWesome!  
03:08 <qwebirc6325> has quit  
04:47 <ssavi> has quit  
05:21 <morrighu> has joined #xwiki  
05:22 <morrighu> Hi I've been playing with XWiki  
05:22 <morrighu> Nice product but I thought I'd mention a couple of things you guys don't seem to know  
05:22 <morrighu> the apt-get install on Ubuntu isn't pulling in the OpenOffice debs  
05:23 <morrighu> and frankly if you're running headless on Lucid LTS you don't want the Ubuntu debs  
05:23 <morrighu> they're broken and will NOT run headless  
05:24 <morrighu> you have to get them from openoffice.org on Lucid.  I'm not sure about anything later than that.  
05:24 <morrighu> I've not done an open office headless on Precise yet (latests LTS) but I'll let you know in a minit  
05:33 <sdumitriu> has quit  
05:43 <morrighu> Well now, precise works quite well headless  
05:43 <morrighu> the command to install it on precise : apt-get install openoffice.org-officebean openoffice.org-thesaurus-en-us openoffice.org-writer libopenoffice-oodoc-perl ooo-thumbnailer ooo2dbk openoffice.org-pdfimport openoffice.org openoffice.org-base openoffice.org-calc openoffice.org-common openoffice.org-impress openoffice.org-java-common extract  openoffice.org-draw openoffice.org-hyphenation-en-us  
05:44 <morrighu> and the command to start it the first time on precise: /usr/bin/openoffice.org -headless -accept="socket,port=8100;urp" -nofirststartwizard &  
05:44 <morrighu> Just as an FYI  
05:45 <morrighu> I'll let you know how to do it on Lucid once I get to work.  I have notes on one of my servers  
05:45 <morrighu> My only complaint is that I'd like to see something more intuitive for adding users to groups  
05:46 <morrighu> Just a small head icon with a plus sign would do it  
06:26 <morrighu> has quit

14:25 <vmassol> guys, has anyone received the jira subscription filter I've set up? It's sent every monday and the last one sent was on the 21st

14:25 <vmassol> I'm with jvdrean and he's telling me he hasn't received it so I'm checking with others  
14:25 <vmassol> it's configured to be sent to the xwiki-committers jira group

14:34 <@cjd> howdy vmassol, WDYT of merging the XWIKI-7748 branch? I'd like to get that in for M2.  
14:34 <+sburjan> vmassol: can you please give me the URL to the xwiki github statistics ? aboun committers/number of commits, etc ?  
14:35 <@cjd> I think it should be acceptable since it's "young" API, more importantly I don't think it's reasonable to assume people are using it.  
14:36 <@cjd> Also I'd like to know the original reason for putting it in public space, it seems like a huge problem since it's an interface, you can't even add a method to it without breaking it.  
14:36 <+tmortagne> sburjan: you have a "Graphs" button in github  
14:36 <+tmortagne> when you are in a repository  
14:37 <+sburjan> thanks

16:58 <+fmancinelli> Hello all, I've a quick question... Does anybody know why -Denforcer.skip=true doesn't work anymore? I have a legacy dependency in a project which used to build using 3.5 poms, but with 4.0 poms enforcer.skip isn't enought to prevent the "banned dependency" error. Any hint?  
16:58 <vmassol> -Dxwiki.enforcer.skip=true

22:42 <@sdumitriu> Make a first iteration, and then we'll provide feedback
